review_title: Strategic and Growing... Things Get Done Here
pros:
A rapidly growing business working as a strong cohesive team.
Decisions are made quickly and efficiently.
A balanced focus on business results and people.
Opportunities to learn, grow, and work on a diverse set of applications.
Nearly everyone has the opportunity to work directly with the customer
cons:
Growing fast and acquisitions means processes are constantly being adjusted and refined to accommodate new business needs
Working efficiently means you may never get everything done on your todo list, so you have to focus on high impact objectives
advice_to_mgmt: The focused investment and growth trajectory are outstanding. You have built an outstanding team with the talent, vision, and ambition to achieve great things!

review_title: Not the worst but there is much better

Good variety of projects to work on

pros: Huge diversity of projects...you will never become bored being stuck in the same old job doing the same thing over and over. Front-line employees are a great team of people to work with. Business model in flux, which creates opportunities for enterprising individuals.
cons: Unfocused growth. Business plan is primarily just to make more money. Senior management have little technical background and little understanding of the core business. Pay raises typically below COL. Stingy profit sharing. Few people who have been at company longer than 10 years.
advice_to_mgmt: Senior management needs to determine what its core business is again and refocus the company on it.

pros: Great people-good collaboration among peers. Friendly atmosphere.
cons: Confusing place to work. I did not see any possibilities for growth and development. It's like someone already posted- a good place for transitioning between jobs.
advice_to_mgmt: Invest in employees who want to advance and continue to perform well. There are a lot of great employees there that are gems in the rough if given the opportunity. Unfortunately those employees move on eventually...

pros: Good work environment, many opportunities to learn and talented colleagues.
cons: Income is not as high as other tech companies, difficult for people to move to upper ranks, employee is not able to innovate or work on personal goals if that doesn't immediately align to corporate vision.
advice_to_mgmt: Management need to put an effort to decentralize the projects and knowledge as people work in silog rather than working in a team oriented fashion

pros: Averna growth is providing interesting opportunities. Great people with good work/life balance. Work environnement is nice.
cons: Internal processes and tools are evolving to support the growth, This are changes that can be seen as exciting opportunities or challenges. your choice.
advice_to_mgmt: continue to control growth speed

pros:
Lot's of opportunities to work on large scale projects
Possibility to travel and work with colleagues in Europe and in US
Management is dynamic, people-centric and clearly looking to grow the company
With all the acquisitions the company is doing, it will give me a lot of opportunities to meet with new colleagues from different countries and cultures ...
Really the place to be if you want an active and motivating worklife.
cons: We are learning to work on projects with colleagues from other offices ... it puts a lot of pressure on how communications are happening ... We need better videoconferencing tools.
advice_to_mgmt: Just continue to fuel the growth ... but make sure we all understand the bigger plan ...

pros: Other than receiving a paycheck for my time, there's nothing positive about working here.
cons:
- Care more about the sale than the client or product quality
- As mentioned by another reviewer, it's a culture of "yes men" and submission
- Politics governs ALL
- Most people are generally unhappy to work there. A lot of turnover in the recent year
- There's a sense if you're not French Canadian, then you're an outsider
- Poor benefits package
advice_to_mgmt: You act like a large company when you're really a small firm. Don't force bureaucracy on your employees and customers. Stop overworking your top performers and pay them what they're worth.

review_title: Pleasant work environment: good people and interesting work
pros: Great environment that offers varied and Interesting work assignments. Relaxed atmosphere. Supportive management that is genuinely values work/life balance. Co-workers are collaborative and helpful.
cons: Good healthcare benefits but short and long term disability isn't subsidized.

pros: "Work at your own pace" environment. Relaxed overall work atmosphere with diverse and hard-working co-workers who all strive for the best.
cons:
Complete disconnect between priorities and business ethics between corporate Montreal offices and USA offices.

To paraphrase Averna management: "Shut up and do your job. Don't complain. Don't bother taking initiative to fix or improve anything. Don't hope, wish, or expect to be ever promoted unless you're already a mid-senior manager. Your remote manager in another country who makes all the decisions of how to do things know better than the people actually doing the job and servicing the customers."

If you suggest any changes or improvements to make the products, services, or processes better then you are seen as a distraction and a threat to the status-quo.
advice_to_mgmt:
Be more open to feedback and ideas from your front-line experts. Soliciting ideas only once a year is a joke.

Share information and don't hoard decision-making authority without at least and without at least consulting your front-line experts.

Empower your people by giving them the tools, resources, and authority necessary to make decisions and be successful.

Provide actual career development plans for your people.

Management needs to be more open to criticism and suggestions and not just don't immediately discredit them because you feel threatened by a subordinate.

cons: Too many political games. Don't tell X this or don't tell Y that. You never knew who you could trust. The culture also caused the company direction to constantly shift. Employee turnover was out of control as well.

review_title: Expanding company, exciting projects, impressive customers
pros: The company has turned around completely for the past 3 years. From almost bankrupt, founders feuding company ... we are now back to growth, focusing on customers and exciting projects ... It just feels good to be around here. I am traveling a lot for project which is great. The management is focused on business and employees, not their ego.
cons: With the number of projects coming in the door, seems to me that we are understaffed as we are often pulled into emergency projects.
advice_to_mgmt: Communicating to employees more often and clearer. With the fast paced environment, I understand that it must not always be simple to communicate efficiently but keep trying as we all want to know the good things that are happening in this company.

review_title: Looking for a professional, technical and personal challenge? This is the place...

- Good work environment
- Multiple short-term and mid-term projects
- Great learning opportunity, technically and professionally.
- Many travel opportunities due to multiple international projects
cons:
- The monetary compensation (and/or other forms of benefits) is never equal to the amount of effort one puts in.
- Project budgets are always tight and the margin of error is very very small.
- Employees are always asked to give more for less.
- Overworked.
advice_to_mgmt:
Be pro-active in the field of employee retention.
Be respectful towards employee and compensate them equally to the efforts they put in and stress load they have to handle in critical situations.

pros:

Very low retention rate of employees due to lay-offs or resignations across the board
Lack of care for individual needs or career path advice
No direction as to where the company is heading
advice_to_mgmt: Treat your employees better, and they will naturally work hard for the company. Try the carrot - not the stick. Help with individual career development and training to retain talent and reduce high turnover rate.

pros: Young dynamic company that is growing fast, but at the same time the executive team seems in control of that growth. Definitely a good experience to evolve in a company that evolve even more itself. Mergers and acquisitions, international growth, integration and development of new products, are example of challenges Averna faces that makes my work more enjoyable as I learn so much. It's a motivating learning environment.
cons: Being a smaller company, the financial benefits of working there are not as interesting as in a bigger company. For an entry-level professional, you do get a sense that they try to exploit your inexperience with salary negotiation and lack of experience to squeeze out of you more work and pay less money for it. They definitely know that the environment is a big plus, so it's seems that they feel that it's okay to be stingier than others
advice_to_mgmt: Human capital management is crucial, especially with gen-y-ers. You say the youth is the future, and that developing leadership within the organization is a priority, I say, I believe that you mean it, just can't quite grasp how you're doing it. Invest in your talents: provide coaching and mentors, subscribe to training courses. Put money where your mouth is.

advice_to_mgmt: Plus de transparence sur la vision à moyen et long terme de l'entreprise.
